titleInfo.title: Letter No 11 of 1822 from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire to Mountstuart Elphinstone, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a small hole which slightly obscures the body of the letter.

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding a dispatch from HM charg√© d'affaires. It further notes that the Resident has issued instructions to Lieutenant-Colonel Rennett to take on extra provisions, in case the Persian Government takes measures to prevent him obtaining supplies from the coast. It also notes that he has issued instructions to Lieutenant Hart and Mr Hunter to return to Bushire, so no unpleasantness may befall them.It also explains that the Resident does not think it likely that the Persian Government will take measures against the Residency, so he will remain at his post unless he faces the threat of force.
